title: ID: Milkbar sign script
content:
This is most likely a handmade logo. Is there a font that looks somewhat like this sign?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [milkbar.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019174724/http:/typophile.com/files/milkbar.jpg) | 79.08 KB |
author: kristin

comments.content: No luck last time, I see. Of course, the previous poster was asking for the exact font. I'm looking for any font with a similar look to it. Any suggestions?

This might have been modified, but I am pretty sure that this is quite closely based on a font.  
It looks very familiar. I hope you find out what it is soon!

Nick Shinn's [Aspect](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019174724/http:/www.typography.net/type/aspect) has the same kind of ligatures.  
But it looks more familiar than just that...

The way the letters are connected…

I wonder if you could recreate this with that.

[http://www.veer.com/products/merchdetail.aspx?image=VPR0005040](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019174724/http:/www.veer.com/products/merchdetail.aspx?image=VPR0005040 "http://www.veer.com/products/merchdetail.aspx?image=VPR0005040")

I have one, but waiting til I have the proper space to use it. Can't wait!
Yes Nick, you're absolutely right! My mistake.

This reminds me of one of Ray Larabie's old freebies, [Dyspepsia](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019174724/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/dyspepsia/), and it also has some similarity to [Prater Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019174724/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/prater-script/).

I believe the first comment, that this is hand drawn (custom) is the right one about this lettering, so anything you pick would need to just be similar.

- Mike Yanega
